text: Eric Howard Carmen (August 11, 1949 - March 2024) was an American singer- songwriter and musician. Carmen was born in Cleveland, Ohio. He was first known as the lead singer of the Raspberries. He had many hit songs in the 1970s and 1980s, first as a member of the Raspberries (who had a million- selling single with "Go All the Way"), and then with his solo career, including hits such as "All by Myself", "Never Gonna Fall in Love Again", "She Did It", "Hungry Eyes", and "Make Me Lose Control". It was announced on March 11, 2024 that Carmen died the week before at the age of 74. ==References== Category:1949 births Category:2024 deaths Category:Singers from Cleveland Category:Musicians from Cleveland Category:American rock singers Category:American rock guitarists Category:American pop singers Category:American pop musicians Category:American keyboardists Category:American singer-songwriters Category:Writers from Cleveland
title: Eric Carmen
